title: Amiloride
summary: Amiloride, sold under the trade name Midamor among others, is a medication typically used with other medications to treat high blood pressure or swelling due to heart failure or cirrhosis of the liver.[1][2] Amiloride is classified as a potassium-sparing diuretic. Amiloride is often used together with another diuretic, such as a thiazide or loop diuretic.[2] It is taken by mouth.[1] Onset of action is about two hours and it lasts for about a day.[2]
